Hello, I am using Visual Studio 2017 and I get this error whenever I try to debug my app:

Any idea please ?
Thanks

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[HUB - ERROR] AES 256 bits rinjdael crypto security with binnary formatter fails on authorization attribute override - Class level" (#1253) at aspnet/SignalR
Events.RelatedBody:
Hello community.

I'm having an issue when I protect hub methods on class level with "AuthorizeAttribute" with an override of the methods.

I'm using AES 256 bits with rinjdael and binnary formatter to make data secure on connection token and other data that's travel from client to server. The first time that's doing the decryption there isn't any problem, but when it's going to decrypt the second time and more times after it, the error of "Padding is invalid and cannot be removed" starts to showing up without stopping.

I've done unit tests passing with several tests of this behaviour to see if it fails but it doesn't.

I'm attaching the log file that's logging the errors at Application_Error of global.asax under "AppDomain.CurrentDomain.FirstChanceException" and "AppDomain.CurrentDomain.UnhandledException".

[SignalRLog.txt](https://github.com/aspnet/SignalR/files/1589020/SignalRLog.txt)

Regards,

Jose Luis Guerra Infante.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[HUB - ERROR] AES 256 bits rinjdael crypto security with binnary formatter fails on authorization attribute override - Class level" (#1253) at aspnet/SignalR
Events.RelatedBody:
Hello community.

I'm having an issue when I protect hub methods on class level with "AuthorizeAttribute" with an override of the methods.

I'm using AES 256 bits with rinjdael and binnary formatter to make data secure on connection token and other data that's travel from client to server. The first time that's doing the decryption there isn't any problem, but when it's going to decrypt the second time and more times after it, the error of "Padding is invalid and cannot be removed" starts to showing up without stopping.

I've done unit tests passing with several tests of this behaviour to see if it fails but it doesn't.

I'm attaching the log file that's logging the errors at Application_Error of global.asax under "AppDomain.CurrentDomain.FirstChanceException" and "AppDomain.CurrentDomain.UnhandledException".

[SignalRLog.txt](https://github.com/aspnet/SignalR/files/1589020/SignalRLog.txt)

Regards,

Jose Luis Guerra Infante.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "HubName or option for DI routes" (#1252) at aspnet/SignalR
Events.RelatedBody:
I'm sorry if this "problem" is already solved and I did not recognize. 

I've waited for the resolve of this issue: #625 

But it seems that HubName attribute will not come back. I use old SignalR-Server with HubName attribute in optional modules and load them at runtime - All signalr routes from modules are correctly set without any manual injection. 

@anurse wrote that the HubName attribute is no longer relevant but IMHO there are many cases where this attribute makes sense... The best option would be if HubName is auto discovered like the route attribute for MVC. 

If anything like this planed or is there any other useful option for auto discovery/setup routes ?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Determine if the temp data cookie is considered essential" (#7160) at aspnet/Mvc
Events.RelatedBody:
RE: aspnet/Security#1561

When this new policy is applied all non-essential cookies will be suppressed. We need to determine if temp data cookie is considered essential by default.

Does MVC issue any other cookies?

@blowdart

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "User name and email confusing" (#1541) at aspnet/Identity
Events.RelatedBody:
Hello!
I was created ASP.Net Core project with individual accounts.
After user registration User Name and Email are same.
I was edit Profile page to change User Name, becouse I want to display user name, not email in top navbar.
At now I cant login, cause signInManager.PasswordSignIn need user_email in user name field.
When I change user email, I still need to signin with user_name=old_user_email.
It's very confusing users and developers.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "An error occurred while calling method 'BuildWebHost' on class 'Program'. Continuing without the application service provider. Error: Scheme already exists: Identity.Application" (#1540) at aspnet/Identity
Events.RelatedBody:
With Entity Framework Core 2.0.0 libraries, I was able to add multiple Identity instances and create a migration.

```
            services.AddIdentity<ApplicationUser, IdentityRole>()
                .AddEntityFrameworkStores<ApplicationDbContext>()
                .AddDefaultTokenProviders();
            services.AddIdentity<DistributorApplicationUser, IdentityRole>()
                .AddEntityFrameworkStores<DistributorApplicationDbContext>()
                .AddDefaultTokenProviders();
            services.AddIdentity<SupplierApplicationUser, IdentityRole>()
                .AddEntityFrameworkStores<SupplierApplicationDbContext>()
                .AddDefaultTokenProviders();
```

I added a library that used Entity Framework Core 2.0.1 and I upgraded all of my libraries to 2.0.1.  Now, the above codes produces

```
An error occurred while calling method 'BuildWebHost' on class 'Program'. Continuing without the application service provider. Error: Scheme already exists: Identity.Application
Unable to create an object of type 'ApplicationDbContext'. Add an implementation of 'IDesignTimeDbContextFactory<ApplicationDbContext>' to the project, or see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=851728 for additional patterns supported at design time
```

When I try to create a migration.

I am using the format:

```
public class Program
    {
        public static void Main(string[] args)
        {
            BuildWebHost(args).Run();
        }

        public static IWebHost BuildWebHost(string[] args) =>
            WebHost.CreateDefaultBuilder(args)
                .UseStartup<Startup>()
                .Build();
    }
```

If one package references 2.0.1 and the other packages reference 2.0.0, I get the following build error:

```
Severity	Code	Description	Project	File	Line	Suppression State
Error	CS1705	Assembly 'Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Relational' with identity 'Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Relational, Version=2.0.1.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=adb9793829ddae60' uses 'Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore, Version=2.0.1.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=adb9793829ddae60' which has a higher version than referenced assembly 'Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore' with identity 'Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore, Version=2.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=adb9793829ddae60'	SM.DAL	w:\documents\visual studio 2017\Projects\SelectMarketing\SM.DAL\CSC	1	Active
```

If all projects reference 2.0.0, I get the following migration error:

```
An error occurred while calling method 'BuildWebHost' on class 'Program'. Continuing without the application service provider. Error: Scheme already exists: Identity.Application
Unable to create an object of type 'ApplicationDbContext'. Add an implementation of 'IDesignTimeDbContextFactory<ApplicationDbContext>' to the project, or see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=851728 for additional patterns supported at design time.
```

At one point, I had three instances of Identity and was able to create three, separate migrations.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "How can I make the Identity working correctly thought a reverse proxy server?" (#1539) at aspnet/Identity
Events.RelatedBody:
I run a demo MVC project which using ASP.NET Identity under a private network (192.168.200.1). And I setup a reverse proxy server (192.168.200.201) to visit it.

I use IIS 6.1 with Application Request Routing (ARR) 2.5 as the reverse proxy server.

In the Identity library, the default LoginPath is **"/Account/Login"**. I don't change it, but when I visit some Action which need Authorized in **192.168.200.201**, it always redirect to **"192.168.200.1/Account/Login"**. It's going wrong! The correct redirect address is **"192.168.200.201/Account/Login"**.

What's wrong with it? I look forward to your reply. Thank you!

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Reenable NPV verification for Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.Design" (#1887) at aspnet/Razor
Events.RelatedBody:
I added a suppression for all NPV rules for `Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.Design` because this package contains assemblies we don't own right now. 

We need to have a conversation about how to ship this tool, and then take the appropriate action and re-renable these rules.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Get rid of LegacyRazorDiagnostic" (#1827) at aspnet/Razor
Events.RelatedBody:
This is coming up again now that I'm dealing with `RazorDiagnostic` in the build-time-Razor work, and it also deserves to just be fixed.

We should port all of our usage of old Razor errors to the new `RazorDiagnostic` class and get rid of the legacy stuff. 


Checklist:

Razor.Language:
- [x] DefaultDirectiveSyntaxTreePass
- [x] CSharpTokenizer
- [x] CSharpCodeParser
- [x] HtmlMarkupParser
- [x] TokenizerBackedParser
- [x] TagHelperParseTreeRewriter
- [x] TagHelperBlockRewriter - Taylor
- [x] DefaultTagHelperTargetExtension - Taylor

Events.RelatedBody:
#1827 

This is the final piece
- Removed `LegacyRazorDiagnostic` and tests
- Removed `RazorError` and tests
- Updated few outdated references

FYI @mkArtakMSFT

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "External Logins does not set the Email" (#67) at aspnet/Templates

- Enable Facebook Login
- Login using Facebook for the first time
- Email field is blank. It should be set from what we got from Facebook

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Identity: Consider less generic name for ManageController" (#86) at aspnet/Templates
Events.RelatedBody:
Manage is a very generic name and you would probably expect http://abcdefg/Manage to be about managing something from your applications business domain rather than user accounts.

ManageAccount would probably be a better name.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Need more templates" (#115) at aspnet/Templates
Events.RelatedBody:
MVC 6 project templates should include a test project template. And the main ASP.NET 5 Preview Templates / Web Application or ... / Empty templates should have a few more sub-options, enabling for example addition and removal of XML support, creation of a minimal MVC project, or adding in EF (without choosing Individual User Accounts authentication).

Hopefully this will allow the new project dialogue to enable the options shown below -- plus a few options specific to MVC 6.
![disabled project features](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6431421/8257821/2a76a606-1665-11e5-8e75-cdb21473f6a1.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Need a SPA template" (#137) at aspnet/Templates
Closed issue "Poor user and dev experience in Identity email confirmation" (#365) at aspnet/Templates
Events.RelatedBody:
There are two issues using the default template for identity when using email confirmation.

Following the guide here: http://docs.asp.net/en/latest/security/authentication/accconfirm.html

Poor user experience: When you click "Register" it sends the email off, but just redirects the user to the Home controller. Redirecting to something else to indicate they have to confirm their account would be a better example. Perhaps the default template should have such a view OOTB.

Poor dev experience: When logging in with an external account (lets say Facebook) if the account doesn't exist you get thrown into AccountController.ExternalLoginConfirmation, great. This screen requires an email, so you complete the registration then you're logged in but never shoots off the email confirmation link here. Perhaps a commented out section in this action to deal with this would improve the dev experience here.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Don't create Project_Readme.html for ASP.NET 5 Empty" (#423) at aspnet/Templates
Events.RelatedBody: I created an empty project for both ASP.NET 4 and ASP.NET 5. The ASP.NET 5 project had a Project_Readme.html and the ASP.NET 4 one did not. I'm not aware if that was on purpose or not, but we should be consistent with the empty projects. I think we should not add the Project_Readme.html for all Empty projects.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "aspnetcore-ci-*, aspnetcore-volatile-* feeds being deprecated" (#282) at aspnet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
As part of some of our infrastructural changes, we're discontinuing the use of the following feeds and may remove them entirely in the future:
* https://dotnet.myget.org/f/aspnetcore-ci-dev 
* https://dotnet.myget.org/f/aspnetcore-ci-release
* https://dotnet.myget.org/f/aspnetcore-volatile-dev
* https://dotnet.myget.org/f/aspnetcore-volatile-release

If you're currently using one of these feeds in your projects to pick up our daily builds, we recommend migrating to https://dotnet.myget.org/f/aspnetcore-dev.

Please use this discussion topic - https://github.com/aspnet/Home/issues/2292 - for feedback and questions.
